item.title: Automaton Distillation for Non-Markovian Knowledge Transfer in Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Existing methods in knowledge transfer as policy distillation suffer from two weaknesses. First, the teacher and student must share the same state space; second, they rely on the Markovian assumptions. We proposed automaton distillation mitigate both issues. We introduce a new and effective method of non-Markovian knowledge transfer that distills knowledge from teacher automaton to student DQN, and experimented on a blind-craftsman environment to display high efficiency and better performance of our proposed automation distillation method.
